decks.notes: This deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays, utilizing creatures like Scrapheap Scrounger and Toolcraft Exemplar to quickly gain board presence. It also includes powerful removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Lightning Strike to control the opponent?s board. The inclusion of vehicles like Heart of Kiran and Aethersphere Harvester provide additional threats and evasion. Hazoret the Fervent serves as a powerful finisher, while cards like Bomat Courier and Chandra, Torch of Defiance help maintain card advantage and tempo. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to establish a fast and aggressive board presence by utilizing cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner, Walking Ballista, and Winding Constrictor to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt, along with powerful creatures like Verdurous Gearhulk and Ravenous Chupacabra, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and maintain control of the battlefield throughout the game. The mana base and additional utility lands provide consistency and flexibility in order to maximize the deck's efficiency.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and aggressively by utilizing a mix of powerful creatures like Hazoret the Fervent and Toolcraft Exemplar, along with efficient removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Lightning Strike. The inclusion of vehicles like Heart of Kiran and Aethersphere Harvester provides additional pressure and evasion. The deck also features strong card advantage cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Bomat Courier to ensure that it can maintain its aggressive pace. With a solid mana base and a proactive game plan, this deck intends to finish the game swiftly.

The deck focuses on early aggression and tempo, utilizing powerful creatures like Bristling Hydra, Jadelight Ranger, and Glint-Sleeve Siphoner to pressure opponents. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt to deal with threats. The inclusion of The Scarab God provides a late-game threat that can generate card advantage and close out games. The mana base is optimized to consistently cast the deck's spells on curve. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm opponents with a mix of efficient creatures and disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through cards like Search for Azcanta and Torrential Gearhulk. The win condition of the deck is to stabilize the board and close out the game with powerful threats like The Scarab God and Torrential Gearhulk. The mana base is designed to allow the deck to consistently hit its colors and curve out efficiently.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced, aggressive gameplay using creatures like Bomat Courier, Earthshaker Khenra, and Hazoret the Fervent to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration, Shock, and Abrade to control the board and clear the way for attacking. The deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats and burn spells, aiming to end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is built around black and red sources to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with strong abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. It includes removal spells to control the board and protect its own creatures. The mana base is built to ensure consistency in casting spells and maximizing the deck's potential. The key strategy is to curve out aggressively with powerful threats like Glorybringer and Rekindling Phoenix while maintaining control with cards like Harnessed Lightning and Thrashing Brontodon. The goal is to apply consistent pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to effectively control the game by stopping the opponent's threats with counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing card draw and graveyard recursion. The deck aims to maintain board control through removal like Fatal Push and Ravenous Chupacabra, while generating card advantage with cards like Hieroglyphic Illumination and Search for Azcanta. The win condition is to outvalue the opponent, with cards like Torrential Gearhulk and The Scarab God providing powerful late-game threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly bring out aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. Utilizing cards like Hazoret the Fervent, Earthshaker Khenra, and Ahn-Crop Crasher, along with cheap removal spells like Shock and Lightning Strike, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and end the game quickly. Path of Mettle provides additional value and the deck uses a mix of mountains and plains for mana consistency. The goal is to maintain a fast pace and pressure the opponent into a quick defeat.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and controlling the board with removal and counter spells. It utilizes powerful creatures like The Scarab God and Torrential Gearhulk to generate value and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and search effects to ensure a steady stream of threats and answers. By efficiently managing resources and making calculated plays, this Grixis Aggro deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells in order to establish board control and deal damage quickly. The deck focuses on utilizing strong creatures such as Glorybringer and Rekindling Phoenix alongside efficient removal options like Magma Spray and Abrade. This allows the deck to apply pressure from the early turns of the game and maintain a strong presence on the battlefield. synergies between cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Heart of Kiran further enhance the overall aggression and resilience of the deck.

The main idea of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while also having removal and combat tricks to deal with any threats. The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Glorybringer, Rekindling Phoenix, and Ghalta, Primal Hunger to quickly apply pressure and close out the game. By combining strong creatures with removal spells like Magma Spray and Abrade, as well as resilient threats like Scrapheap Scrounger, this deck aims to be proactive and efficient in its strategy.

This Merfolk aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost Merfolk creatures and leveraging tribal synergies to overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Metallic Mimic and Merfolk Mistbinder boost the power of your creatures, while Kumena, Tyrant of Orazca provides card draw and additional utility. Unsummon and Essence Scatter help to control the opponent's board and buy you time to set up your own. By utilizing Unclaimed Territory and Botanical Sanctum, you can ensure you have the mana you need to deploy your creatures quickly and efficiently.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures. The key strategy is to play low-cost Merfolk creatures like Kumena's Speaker and Mist-Cloaked Herald to quickly establish a strong board state. Metallic Mimic and Deeproot Elite help boost the power of the Merfolk creatures, while Kumena, Tyrant of Orazca provides valuable card draw and utility. By utilizing the tribal synergies and aggressive nature of the deck, the goal is to swarm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to generate early pressure and maintain a fast-paced aggressive strategy. With a combination of low-cost creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and finish them off before they can stabilize. Cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Hazoret the Fervent provide additional value and reach, while creatures like Kari Zev, Skyship Raider and Ahn-Crop Crasher ensure consistent damage output. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's low curve and maximize efficiency.

The deck focuses on controlling the board using counterspells and removal spells like Disallow and Settle the Wreckage. It aims to stall the game until it can cast Approach of the Second Sun twice to win. Search for Azcanta helps find key cards while Gideon of the Trials helps protect against threats. The deck also includes card draw and card selection spells like Glimmer of Genius and Supreme Will to help find key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win through a slow and methodical approach.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Earthshaker Khenra and Hazoret the Fervent. It also utilizes burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to both red and white mana sources. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast creature threats and efficient removal spells to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and creating card advantage through cycling cards. The deck utilizes cards like Archfiend of Ifnir and Nimble Obstructionist to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also being able to generate value from cycling cards with Abandoned Sarcophagus. The deck also has some win conditions with cards like The Scarab God and Drake Haven. The goal is to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using creatures with strong enters-the-battlefield abilities and disruption spells, while working towards getting God-Pharaoh's Gift onto the battlefield. This artifact allows you to bring powerful creatures back from the graveyard, providing a constant stream of threats for your opponent to deal with. By controlling the board and utilizing the graveyard effectively, you can overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board and mill your own cards to fill up your graveyard with creatures. By using Gate to the Afterlife to search for God-Pharaoh's Gift, you can bring back powerful creatures like Angel of Invention and The Scarab God to overwhelm your opponent. Ravenous Chupacabra and Fatal Push provide removal options, while Champion of Wits helps with card draw. The deck focuses on managing resources effectively and utilizing graveyard recursion to gain advantage over your opponent.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient and powerful creatures, such as Verdurous Gearhulk and Glint-Sleeve Siphoner, to quickly overwhelm opponents. By utilizing cards like Winding Constrictor and Rishkar, Peema Renegade to bolster your creatures and generate extra mana, you can create a fast and aggressive board presence. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt help deal with opposing threats, while cards like Aethersphere Harvester provide additional versatility and defense. This deck aims to swiftly apply pressure and maintain control of the battlefield to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing +1/+1 counters and efficient creature removal to pressure opponents with aggressive plays. By leveraging cards like Verdurous Gearhulk, Walking Ballista, and Winding Constrictor, as well as solid creatures like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Ravenous Chupacabra, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly. With a balance of creatures, removal, and support spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt, the Golgari Aggro archetype seeks to maintain board control and apply constant pressure to secure victory.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive creatures, backed up by efficient removal spells and powerful finishers. It focuses on playing threats early and often, utilizing cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Rekindling Phoenix to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Ghalta, Primal Hunger allows for explosive plays that can quickly close out games. With a mixture of resilient creatures and versatile removal, this deck seeks to maintain constant pressure and punish the opponent for any missteps.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By using cards like Bomat Courier, Toolcraft Exemplar, and Heart of Kiran, the deck can put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Scrapheap Scrounger and Hazoret the Fervent provide additional threats that are difficult to deal with, while Chandra, Torch of Defiance offers card advantage and additional reach. The inclusion of Aethersphere Harvester and Pia Nalaar adds resilience and flexibility to the deck's game plan. Overall, the goal is to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using creatures like Bomat Courier, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Toolcraft Exemplar. It also includes powerful threats like Hazoret the Fervent and Chandra, Torch of Defiance to push for additional damage. The deck includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Strike to clear the way for its creatures to attack and finish the game quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of vehicles like Heart of Kiran and Aethersphere Harvester helps maintain pressure on the opponent while providing additional reach and resilience.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a board of Merfolk creatures that benefit from each other's presence, using cards like Metallic Mimic, Deeproot Elite, and Merfolk Mistbinder to boost their power and toughness. By swarming the board with Merfolk and playing cards like Kumena, Tyrant of Orazca and Tempest Caller, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win through aggressive creature attacks. The deck also includes a few control elements like Essence Scatter and Unsummon to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing removal spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt to control the board and maintain dominance. Sweltering Suns provides additional board sweep capabilities while Chandra, Torch of Defiance generates card advantage and can finish off opponents. Treasure Map helps with card selection and mana ramp, while cards like Glorybringer and Rekindling Phoenix provide strong threats. The deck also includes Tetzimoc, Primal Death for additional removal and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and removal spells.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck focuses on dropping low-cost creatures like Bomat Courier and Earthshaker Khenra, while also utilizing powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock to finish off opponents. Hazoret the Fervent serves as a powerful finisher, while cards like Pia Nalaar provide support and additional creature presence. With a strong focus on speed and aggression, this deck aims to take control of the game early and maintain pressure until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on generating an abundance of tokens to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Anointed Procession and Hidden Stockpile, the deck can double the amount of tokens produced. Cards like Legion's Landing and Anointer Priest help in creating tokens efficiently. Vraska, Relic Seeker can provide additional token generation and removal. The deck also includes some removal spells like Fatal Push and Cast Out to handle threats from the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the aggro strategy with a mix of lands that can produce different colors.

The deck focuses on creating and utilizing tokens to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive strategy. Cards like Anointed Procession, Legion's Landing, and Hidden Stockpile help generate tokens efficiently, while Anointer Priest provides additional value. The deck also includes powerful threats like The Scarab God and Angel of Sanctions to apply pressure. Fatal Push and Fumigate are included for removal and board control, ensuring the deck can handle various threats. Overall, the deck aims to flood the board with tokens and apply constant pressure to secure victories.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through countering and removing threats while drawing cards to find key pieces. By using cards like Disallow and Settle the Wreckage to disrupt opponents' strategies, along with powerful draw spells like Glimmer of Genius and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to out-value and outlast opponents. The win condition is to cast Approach of the Second Sun twice, ensuring victory through a powerful alternate win condition.
